basics.name: Ryan Seymour
basics.label: Game Developer & E-Learning Coordinator
basics.summary: Seeking opportunities to expand game design knowledge and to collaborate on engaging, educational games.

courses: Museum Manager, Augmented Reality simulation Game
Tour of Williamsburg, Virtual Reality 3D modeling of historical buildings
Toxicity, 3D Digital Game of immune response
Sprouts, Boardgame relating to farming and resource management
Darwin's Angry Finches, Boardgame teaching natural selection
Fantasy Taxonomy, Card game teaching taxonomy
Gender Analysis of Video Game Play, Thesis

work.summary: Provided faculty and student support and technical assistance with the school’s e-learning resources.  Collaborated with faculty members to develop and design digital content and integrate coursework into the learning management system.  Implemented new digital learning tools, such as online testing and video presentations, to enhance classroom interactive experiences.  Developed and presented technical training seminars and support documents on education technology systems.  Managed updates to division’s website and Blackboard database.
highlights: Provide user support for the organization's Learning Management System to faculty and students
Maintain LMS database functionality while providing support for server updates
Project manager for students seeking to develop skills and projects related to game development

work.position: Executive Assistant to the Dean of Undergraduate Education
work.summary: Analyzed datasets from student surveys.  Provided support to the Living Learning Communities, including program development and outreach.  Managed special events, meetings, scheduling and travel planning for the Office of Undergraduate Studies.  Managed workflows utilizing Microsoft SharePoint for the student petition process, purchase orders, student retention, and course transfer articulation.  Facilitated student inquiries regarding scholar and award programs, advising and petitions.  Served as the primary customer service contact for the office, handling walk-in, telephone and e-mail inquiries in a friendly, prompt manner.  Collaborated with faculty and staff to develop Kaltura-based presentations for honors course topics.  Supervised one student worker.
highlights: Maintained and developed Sharepoint databases for office workflows and processes
Analyzed datasets to improve outreach of department
Collaborate with faculty and administrators to develop video lessons for online learning initatives

work.summary: Managed all aspects of English language training programs, including the student application, testing, payment and conduct processes.  Supervised teachers, administrative staff and student workers, including training, recruitment, scheduling and performance reviews.   Advised ESL students on academic and extracurricular opportunities.  Administered digital TOEFL and English placement assessment tests. Created and analyzed Excel spreadsheets to track and verify student and staff policy compliance.  Organized special events, including student receptions, guest speakers and field trips.  Created active learning experiences through visiting the Smithsonian Institution museums.
highlights: Supervised teachers, administrative staff and student workers in various facets that include: training, recruitment, scheduling and performance reviews
Advised ESL students on academic and extracurricular opportunities
Developed active learning experiences for students through planning field trips to the Smithsonian Institution museums
Fluvanna Middle School,Life Science Student Teacher, 2012
